comment: biggest problem i had with this teacher is how much outside resources you need to use to get a better understanding especially when it comes to the homework. other than that you get free points for doing the practice problems and warm up quizes. the quizes were open notes. everything outside the coding portion on the test is pulled from the book.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: AVOID THIS PROFESSOR. Never responds to emails, lies on students to cover themselves, and refuses to accept makeups even with a doctor's note. Grading is brutal with no clear instructions or sample output provided for you to go based on. When you ask her questions her only response is to go to GTA. Will assign work over breaks, never again!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: she's a terrible professor. she doesn't even teach or explain things she just sends you to the GTA!

I'm not sure what all these low ratings are for, but IMO, Prof McManus was great. She expects students to use common sense when working out problems and asking questions. Her assignments, quizzes, and tests were all very straightforward. I genuinely learned much from this class, which can't be said about most of my SWE classes here. Take this prof!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Online Savvy

comment: Her "grading criteria" is about as clear as mud. Good luck getting any clarification too - she's busy ignoring emails like it's a second job. Makes you really wonder how she made her way into a professorship in the first place.

Professor McManus should not be your first choice for a class. She uses lectures created by a professor in 2021 and sends links to youtube videos which could be found by searching the same topics on google. She also incentivizes not emailing her for bonus points on a single assignment. She truly made operating systems harder than it should be.

Ima be real. This professor was pretty disorganized at first but you can get used to it. We have 12 assignments, 12 Practice Quizes, 6 Actual Quizes, 6 Warmup Quizzes, 3 Tests, and a Final. It sounds like a lot but it's manageable. Tbh the majority of the work is selflearned though, but being an online course, you can just look it up online anyway.

I had only 2 classes left in my major in KSU before I took OS. Never have had to drop a course. Enter Carla McManus. Worst professor I've taken; her idea of teaching is forcing you to read the textbook; her supplemental "aids" were  recycled powerpoints and old lecture videos she stole from another professor. It's passable.

Very unclear with instructions, failed a coding assignment because I was unable to see her invisible instructions. If you follow the visible instructions, you will fail and get half the grade taken for "not turning in the assignment correctly." Completed both parts 1 and 2 of assignment just to get told I didn't, my output matched hers.(-40 pts)

The way you turn something in will cost you more points than if you did the assignment or not. God forbid you use replit as an IDE either it's too cumbersome and you will lose 50 points for an assignment you did all the work for. Lost another 40% for not turning in a pdf when I did cause it was the only file I turned in.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Ms, McManus is a pretty bad professor. Her structure is very unorganized and there's almost no clear way to prep for ANY of her insanely difficult quizzes and exams, Just vague topics that might be on there with no resources or powerpoints lecture slides. She also doesn't respond to emails and doesn't even grade anything her TA does. DONT take her.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Class is just you reading the text book. No instructor input and they use powerpoint from the text and other sources. Literally  does nothing. If you take this class, you are wasting your money, because you will teach yourself everything.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Class consists of a textbook and PowerPoints created by the author of the textbook. In addition, videos are provided but they're all from YouTube channels and none she has created. Also there are only 4 quizzes, 4 assignments, and 3 tests. Props to her, she seems to be sitting back doing the bare minimum and gets paid for it. Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: extremely lazy and did not provide ANY material except a powerpoint with definitions + video of a guy reading the powerpoint. Im not exaggerating, these were the only two materials aside from the textbook for each module. Its pathetic how little this professor cares. She does not even grade anything, GTA's do that. why is this person getting paid?
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: I really thought she did a good job preparing students for the real world interview questions! A lot of my interveiw questions have been based on data strucutres, and I felt really prepared because of her material. The assingments are questions from the book, & she gives great feedback. Her quizzes and test are usually straight from the book.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Good intentions, but is not a "professor". The teacher assistants grade everything and they are all unoriginal assignments/tests. I would not recommend taking her for Data Structures because it is far too time consuming. I have to say though, she is very kind and took on many students due to the online course; I think around 70-80, so good on her.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Only resources given is the textbook and the guy who made the textbook's powerpoint videos. She does not help or explain anything, never teaching anything of her own or making things easy to understand. Hard to communicate with as she responds hours, or days late or not at all. And can't tweak or use online code to help with assignments cuz if so=0
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment:
This class made me want to drop out.
Only materials she gave us to were the textbook and lectures from another professor.
The assignments were vague and often had instructions that were wrong (i.e. "use the BinaryTree class from the java library" - there isn't one). 
And we couldn't even look online for those classes bc any unoriginal code=a 0.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework
